intro: Galium aristatum var. transsilvanicum, commonly known as Transylvanian bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and have a slightly hairy texture. Transylvanian bedstraw thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
